description: In the wake of the BCI shutdown, neighborhood assemblies form to address grievances and summon former Council members for questioning. Oksana Lintz prepares to present evidence in upcoming citizen tribunals.

Oksana Lintz chooses to present only focused technical evidence about BCI abuses at a public tribunal, allowing citizens to deliberate specific cases of injustice involving system erasures and privilege exceptions.
Lenart Kova and other former officials are brought before citizen-led panels, where they face pointed questions about BCI decision processes and accountability lapses.
A restored 'ghost' testifies at the tribunal, revealing they were erased after exposing BCI's systemic bias, changing public perception of disappearances and institutional injustices.
Citywide debate intensifies: some argue for restoring central authority for stability, while others call to preserve the new community-led justice systems emerging from the tribunal process.
